editor.title: Editor
editor.description: Links to identifiers of persons responsible for maintaining the entry.

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of the entry (published, draft, rejected)

date_modified.title: Date Modified
date_modified.description: The datetime on which the metadata was last updated in the AIoD platform,in UTC.  Note the difference between `.aiod_entry.date_created` and `.date_published`: the former is automatically set to the datetime the resource was created on AIoD, while the latter can optionally be set to an earlier datetime that the resource was published on an external platform.

date_created.title: Date Created
date_created.description: The datetime on which the metadata was first published on the AIoD platform, in UTC.

region.title: Region
region.description: A subdivision of the country. Not necessary for most countries.

address.title: Address
address.description: Free text, in case the separate parts such as the street, postal code and country cannot be confidently separated.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The external platform from which this resource originates. Leave empty if this item originates from AIoD. If platform is not None, the platform_resource_identifier should be set as well.

platform_resource_identifier.title: Platform Resource Identifier
platform_resource_identifier.description: A unique identifier issued by the external platform that's specified in 'platform'. Leave empty if this item is not part of an external platform. For example, for HuggingFace, this should be the <namespace>/<dataset_name>, and for Openml, the OpenML identifier.

date_published.title: Date Published
date_published.description: The datetime (utc) on which this resource was first published on an external platform. Note the difference between `.aiod_entry.date_created` and `.date_published`: the former is automatically set to the datetime the resource was created on AIoD, while the latter can optionally be set to an earlier datetime that the resource was published on an external platform.

same_as.title: Same As
same_as.description: Url of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates this resource's identity.

is_accessible_for_free.title: Is Accessible For Free
is_accessible_for_free.description: A flag to signal that this asset is accessible at no cost.

issn.title: Issn
issn.description: The International Standard Serial Number, ISSN, an identifier for serial publications.

measurement_technique.title: Measurement Technique
measurement_technique.description: The technique, technology, or methodology used in a dataset, corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s).

temporal_coverage.title: Temporal Coverage
temporal_coverage.description: The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format. In the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written '2011/2012').

ai_resource_identifier.title: Ai Resource Identifier
ai_resource_identifier.description: This resource can be identified by its own identifier, but also by the resource_identifier.

alternate_name.title: Alternate Name
alternate_name.description: An alias for the item, commonly used for the resource instead of the name.

application_area.title: Application Area
application_area.description: The objective of this AI resource.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Contact information of persons/organisations that can be contacted about this resource.

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: Contact information of persons/organisations that created this resource.

funder.title: Funder
funder.description: Links to identifiers of the agents (person or organization) that supports this dataset through some kind of financial contribution.

industrial_sector.title: Industrial Sector
industrial_sector.description: A business domain where a resource is or can be used.

keyword.title: Keyword
keyword.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this resource, providing additional context.

media.title: Media
media.description: Images or videos depicting the resource or associated with it.

relevant_link.title: Relevant Link
relevant_link.description: URLs of relevant resources. These resources should not be part of AIoD (use relevant_resource otherwise). This field should only be used if there is no more specific field.

research_area.title: Research Area
research_area.description: The research area is similar to the scientific_domain, but more high-level.

scientific_domain.title: Scientific Domain
scientific_domain.description: The scientific domain is related to the methods with which an objective is reached.

size.title: Size
size.description: The size of this dataset, for example the number of rows. The file size should not be included here, but in distribution.content_size_kb.

spatial_coverage.title: Spatial Coverage
spatial_coverage.description: A location that describes the spatial aspect of this dataset. For example, a point where all the measurements were collected.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: Text indicating the unit of measurement.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The external platform from which this resource originates. Leave empty if this item originates from AIoD. If platform is not None, the platform_resource_identifier should be set as well.

platform_resource_identifier.title: Platform Resource Identifier
platform_resource_identifier.description: A unique identifier issued by the external platform that's specified in 'platform'. Leave empty if this item is not part of an external platform. For example, for HuggingFace, this should be the <namespace>/<dataset_name>, and for Openml, the OpenML identifier.

checksum.title: Checksum
checksum.description: The value of a checksum algorithm ran on this content.

date_published.title: Date Published
date_published.description: The datetime (utc) on which this Distribution was first published on an external platform.

technology_readiness_level.title: Technology Readiness Level
technology_readiness_level.description: The technology readiness level (TRL) of the distribution. TRL 1 is the lowest and stands for 'Basic principles observed', TRL 9 is the highest and stands for 'actual system proven in operational environment'.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude of a location in degrees (WGS84)

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude of a location in degrees (WGS84)

elevation_millimeters.title: Elevation Millimeters
elevation_millimeters.description: The elevation in millimeters with tespect to the WGS84 ellipsoid

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The external platform from which this resource originates. Leave empty if this item originates from AIoD. If platform is not None, the platform_resource_identifier should be set as well.

pid.description: A permanent identifier for the model, for example a digital object identifier (DOI). Ideally a url.

name.description: The name of the platform, such as huggingface, openml or zenodo. Preferably using snake_case.

checksum.title: Checksum

date_published.description: The datetime (utc) on which this Distribution was first published on an external platform.

technology_readiness_level.title: Technology Readiness Level
technology_readiness_level.description: The technology readiness level (TRL) of the distribution. TRL 1 is the lowest and stands for 'Basic principles observed', TRL 9 is the highest and stands for 'actual system proven in operational environment'.

installation_script.title: Installation Script
installation_script.description: An url pointing to a script that can be run to setup the environment necessary for running this distribution. This can be a relative url, if this distribution is a file archive.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: A human readable explanation of the installation, primarily meant as alternative for when there is no installation script.

installation_time_milliseconds.title: Installation Time Milliseconds
installation_time_milliseconds.description: An illustrative time that the installation might typically take.

deployment_script.title: Deployment Script
deployment_script.description: An url pointing to a script that can be run to use this resource. This can be a relative url, if this distribution is a file archive.

deployment.title: Deployment
deployment.description: A human readable explanation of the deployment, primarily meant as alternative for when there is no installation script.
deployment.example: You can run the run.py file using python3. See README.md for required arguments.

deployment_time_milliseconds.title: Deployment Time Milliseconds
deployment_time_milliseconds.description: An illustrative time that the deployment might typically take.

os_requirement.title: Os Requirement
os_requirement.description: A human readable explanation for the required os.

dependency.title: Dependency
dependency.description: A human readable explanation of (software) dependencies.
dependency.example: Python packages as listed in requirements.txt.

hardware_requirement.title: Hardware Requirement
hardware_requirement.description: A human readable explanation of hardware requirements.
